quote.text: You cannot whisper a sigh in your bedchambers without a Vespitole hearing about it.
Fill every empty space of the mind with agony so that lies have no refuge. Whatever remains is the truth.
Dalmiria is so rich in spices that a commoner will consume a lord's ransom in a single meal.
Just as the wind can be harnessed to mill, so hath their prayers, bent to His will.
The philosophers can go debate justice until the sun burns to embers, for I am blessed by God and will bring calamity down on all who oppose me.
I claim no nation, I follow no gods. Commerce is my worship and gold is my prayer.
A law is only as fair as the men who interpret it. Men with desires, fears, ambitions and secrets.
The rumors are true. The church hosts a secret order of thaumaturges that have trained countless generations of Vespitole in their dark arts.
You have us until harvest, and not a day after.
A Mercenary is an alchemist. He heats cold iron with hot blood, and from that crucible he pours gold.
Some were born to craft songs, and some to craft prayers. Some were born to craft fine works of art. I was born to craft death, and your army will be my masterpiece.
'Xoros is the greatest bullfighter in the world,' may be an obvious lie, but you are still tricked to believe Xoros fights bulls, or that he even exists at all.
I assume you have a signed permit to move an army through the West gates?
The whispers of idle rumors stoke the flames of funeral pyres.
Those who cannot pay in coin, cloth, or salt will pay in blood, bruises, and broken bones.
Though many others wage their wars with armies, mine are waged with gold.
Though the armies will march many miles on beef and bread, wine keeps them from feeling their feet!
No merchant will accept your gold. No ports will harbor your ships. When your people rise against you, you will curse my name to the heavens and the heavens will side with me.

cardText.text: One drawn card is an ally

quote.text: Gather the coarse, waxy hairs from adult males. The more the better. Soak them in an open basket with water and finch weed. They will swell and yellow until a jelly forms that must be collected with the shell of a hess beetle.
Orphans cover Sitrak like fleas cover aurochs.
Slaves do not dream of freedom. When their eyes sadden at the gleam of gold, they are not pining to be free. They want slaves of their own.
An empty belly growls louder than any war drum.
Hark, O lost child! Feast with our flock and you shall never feel hunger again.
These cities are the bloated carcasses of a feeble race, and I am the spear ready to burst them.
There is no yoke I cannot shatter, nor chain I cannot snap. Only the mighty are free.
When I unleash a thousand thundering hooves even the Earth trembles in fear.
With silent devotion, they caress the Earth with tiny fingers under the night sky. Blessed is their fur, their dung and their blood.
If beetles and maggots can fatten from the fruits of death, so can I.
We live invisibly amongst them, an empire hidden within all other lands. Allied under Metris, we are invincible.
Do not be afraid, you are fortunate to be chosen by me. The lives we take live forever in our stories.
It took years to build what I can destroy in minutes.
The theft of the Holy writs was a heinous violation, both of the spirit and the holy coffers.
Few can recognize an illegitimate seal. They are too enamored with the honor of written orders from above to hold them to any scrutiny.
Some men's hearts are like a lock to pick, but most simply hand you the key.
There is only one outcome for a world where everyone gets what they want; self annihilation.
A good conspiracy is so convoluted that any description of its design will be unbelievable. Reason, our most cherished virtue, is also our greatest disguise.
When a man cries his innocence the angry mob only hears his confession.
A proud stone tower may be laid to ruin by an army of toiling laborers, or it can be toppled by a single cunning blow to its weakest stone.
The shrewd lord checks to see that the numbers add up. The wise lord checks to see that the numbers are the real numbers.
His quivering hand held the chalice, and he asked, somewhat absentmindedly, why his fingers tingled so?
Sacrificing dozens, hundreds or thousands of lives to save the rest of humanity is not only justified, but the only sane choice.

Soothe the animal until it willingly gives you its cud, which must be immediately put into the still-warm milk from its own mother. Mix it with a dying man's dung until it becomes a thick, sticky paste.
Find a pregnant sow. Have a dozen men scream at her until she is forced into early birth. Ferment each suckling in separate leather sacks, inscribed with the symbols 'haf,' 'lem,' 'peth,' and 'kos.'

Exhume the corpse of a drowned calf from a fetid pond. Remove the clotted blood and mix with bile, and place into pots heated by the noon sun. Ferment for six days, and strain the liquor through a blind child's hair.
There are no new ideas. Everything has already been recorded by historians or predicted by sibyls.
By Penderach's decree, all profits pulled from the soil from the White Hill to the River Wren must pass through my fingers first.
A city suckles at the ports for milk, and those that control the ships drink only cream.

Storms never sink their ships. Their enemies fall mysteriously ill. Every day, fortune graces them with opportunities that others may see once in their lives. For reasons I cannot fathom, God listens to House Vespitole.
The divine word can encourage even the mouse to rise against the wolf.
It's not witchcraft when God does it.
Graze not on grass this day, for your horns will rake the sky, and your rumen will boil with blood!
The serf knows two things: to work the fields, and to obey.
I have spent more time in armor than most have spent awake. My skin is metal, my legs: a horse, and my arm a vengeful sword, honed on bones of weaker men.
Your family has done much for his church, I believe God owes you a favor.
The Cardinals gather around the Penderach's corpse staging elaborate rituals to trick each other into believing the Penderach somehow approves of their agenda.
Of course all are beloved, both pauper and lord. Holy favor simply gazes more fondly upon gold, just as a flower follows the sun.
Let them deafen the Pendrach with misguided praise. Their feeble minds cannot fathom the power they give me.
Churn the earth into a red wallow. Rend the world asunder with frenzied hoof, and tearing tusk!
The valley is ever-fertile. The herds roam thick, on four legs and on two.
Let the weeping sores of the lepers quench their thirst for war!
If we are ever discovered, do you think they will thank us for the countless villainies we have perpetrated on their supposed behalf?
Big rats, small rats, rats with horns, rats with no legs. Fighting rats, talking rats, they all fit in my cage.
Possessions are fickle friends.
Berries black as darkest night, fall to sleep without a fight.
Each day he grows weaker, like an untended fire slowly burning to cold ash.

cardText.text: Pick a card in foe's bank

quote.text: A fool will always trust news he wants to hear.
When your enemy has a good idea, use it.
You don't need to tell a servant that authority is a lie. You give them the means to resist it.
The secret to wealth is to loan more gold than you have, and threaten more war than you can make.
Any coward can hold a spear and stand on the line. It takes a Marshal to make that coward march to his own death through fire and pain with grim determination.
A commoner will confess any secret for the mere thrill of participating in something bigger than their tiny little lives.
To subvert defeat into victory you must be aware, in advance, of every possible outcome.
We master life to harvest the fruits of death.
Seek the altar deep within the earth's wet maw and transcribe each symbol exactly.
Grow long and grow fat, and my fires will burn everlasting.
To master a trade one must do more than study. Stonemasons must work the rock. Farriers must work the forge. So it is also with war. Let us go and hone our craft.
Gold is power. Anyone who disagrees possesses neither.
The only moment your enemy should fully understand your plan is just before their death.
...drown the night with screaming, spill the offal at the edge of the circle, and wreath her with entrails. This will please the Shepherd, and He will reciprocate...
Torturers, soldiers, spies, and kings all spill fields of blood to wrench whispered half truths from their victims. Ours lay bare their every secret without a drop spilt.

The invaders had never seen a two-story building, let alone a sheer wall of mortared stone. They had to quickly school themselves in the ways of modern siege warfare, and the tuition was paid with the cracking of bones.
Two tankards of ale, coming right up, m'lords. You sure that's all you want?
I'll bloody my knuckles on anyone. Old men, women, cripples, kids. You just pay the coin and point them out.
Men will always fight harder for a lord with battle scars.
All things die so that their flesh may feed the young.
Wars are expensive. I'm sure we can find a solution that is in both of our best interests.
I don't care how you got those wounds, I tend to the hurt, no questions asked.
The wealthy wise duchess always knew: loose in the fingers, the coins fall through. In the bed of straw thieving rats will chew. In the bank of stone, one ducat becomes two.
All Endazu know this simple mark. It is scribed upon the earth within a circle, and for a time no harm may enter that space, just as a newly-waxed boot repels water.
Magic is learning to control an invisible limb you can neither feel nor touch.

He drew the sign in the air as he pointed his filagreed sword toward the distant soldier, and at his feet there was a crackle as the air was rent in a shower of sparks. The soldier was thrown up and then to the ground, his clothing and armor in tatters. He shuddered, and did not rise.

As she read from the long page of script, a warm breeze surged from within the walls though we were in a sealed room with no windows. The air itself soon filled with fluttering Argoreth petals, and though I was a prisoner in that place, I felt the glee of a child wandering through a blooming orchard.
Most speak in the silken tongue of poetic speech. Only a few will ever learn the raw words of arcane power. The Endazu are fluent in both.
The curious Argoreth flower is only to be found growing in their strange citadel. It needed neither water nor sunlight, and it seemed to be rooted down to the world between worlds.

Within the gold-bound tome were strange pages of an unknown skin. Through some secret method, my captor could merely think a passage or design, and it would ink itself upon the page. This very passage could at any time be willed back to the fore, ready to recommit to memory.
The dead will tirelessly fight for you but do not seek their undying servitude without gold to give, for the dead are vain.
When you see their citadel, tarry not. The traveller that does not hasten away from that place will die in silence under the gaze of that deadly golden orb.
The dead transcribe tirelessly with speed and precision. A scroll can be copied in minutes, an entire book overnight.
Seek the dead priest in his sarcophagus and speak aloud his true name. He alone can speak for the dead, and he alone can grant your golden army.

The word was no mere utterance from the mouth of man. It resounded, pulsed in my mind, my skin, and even the earth and sky shuddered for a time. The Word of Unmaking tears something right out of our world, like cutting a stained spot from a cloak, and then mends it back until you cannot detect the hole was ever there.

The assassin knew not what tore him from his feet, it was as though he were suddenly tossed into unseen roiling rapids. The Endazu can summon a fearsome force that briefly twists the very fabric of the world.
When you first hold the document, you can feel the very essence of life flowing in through your fingers, filling you with vitality. The terms of the treaty are the last thing on your mind.

cardText.text: When a foe or ally dies:

quote.text: They don't believe me, but I saw what took Khalib that night. Its arms coalesced from the darkness itself and stole his life, leaving a hollowed husk with a face frozen in a silent scream.
